member.name: F:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.ZERO_FAHRENHEIT_AS_RANKINE
member.summary: Zero degree Fahrenheit (°F) expressed as degree Rankine (°R). Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 39.

member.name: F:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.ZERO_CELSIUS_AS_KELVIN
member.summary: Zero degree Celsius (°C) expressed as Kelvin (K). Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 39.

member.name: F:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.R_DA_IP
member.summary: Universal gas constant for dry air (IP version) in ft lb_Force lb_DryAir⁻¹ R⁻¹. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1.

member.name: F:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.R_DA_SI
member.summary: Universal gas constant for dry air (SI version) in J kg_DryAir⁻¹ K⁻¹. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1.

member.name: F:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.INVALID
member.summary: Invalid value (dimensionless).

member.name: F:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.MAX_ITER_COUNT
member.summary: Maximum number of iterations before exiting while loops.

member.name: F:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.MIN_HUM_RATIO
member.summary: Minimum acceptable humidity ratio used/returned by any functions. Any value above 0 or below the MIN_HUM_RATIO will be reset to this value.

member.summary: Freezing point of water in Fahrenheit.

member.summary: Freezing point of water in Celsius.

member.summary: Triple point of water in Fahrenheit.

member.name: P:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.UnitSystem
member.summary: Gets or Sets the current system of units for the calculations.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.#ctor(EazyLab.PsychroLib.UnitSystem)
member.summary: Constructor to create instance with the specified unit system.
member.param: System of units to utilize for calculations.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetTRankineFromTFahrenheit(System.Double)
member.summary: Utility function to convert temperature to degree Rankine (°R) given temperature in degree Fahrenheit (°F). Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 section 3
member.param: Temperature in Fahrenheit (°F)
member.returns: Rankine (°R)

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetTFahrenheitFromTRankine(System.Double)
member.summary: Utility function to convert temperature to degree Fahrenheit (°F) given temperature in degree Rankine (°R). Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 section 3
member.param: Temperature in Rankine (°R)
member.returns: Fahrenheit (°F)

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetTKelvinFromTCelsius(System.Double)
member.summary: Utility function to convert temperature to Kelvin (K) given temperature in degree Celsius (°C). Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 section 3
member.param: Temperature in Celsius (°C)
member.returns: Rankine (°R)

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetTCelsiusFromTKelvin(System.Double)
member.summary: Utility function to convert temperature to degree Celsius (°C) given temperature in Kelvin (K). Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 section 3
member.param: Temperature in Rankine (°R)
member.returns: Celsius (°C)

member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Dew point temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Wet bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]

member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Relative humidity [0-1]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Wet bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]

Dew point temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]

member.summary: Return relative humidity given dry-bulb temperature, wet bulb temperature and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Wet bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Relative humidity [0-1]

member.summary: Return dew-point temperature given dry-bulb temperature, wet-bulb temperature, and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Wet bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Dew Point temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetVapPresFromRelHum(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return partial pressure of water vapor as a function of relative humidity and temperature. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 12, 22
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Relative humidity [0-1]
member.returns: Partial pressure of water vapor in moist air in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetRelHumFromVapPres(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return relative humidity given dry-bulb temperature and vapor pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 12, 22
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Partial pressure of water vapor in moist air in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Relative humidity [0-1]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.dLnPws_(System.Double)
member.summary: Helper function returning the derivative of the natural log of the saturation vapor pressure as a function of dry-bulb temperature. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn. 5 & 6
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
member.returns: Derivative of natural log of vapor pressure of saturated air in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetTDewPointFromVapPres(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return dew-point temperature given dry-bulb temperature and vapor pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn. 5 and 6 Notes: the dew point temperature is solved by inverting the equation giving water vapor pressure at saturation from temperature rather than using the regressions provided by ASHRAE (eqn. 37 and 38) which are much less accurate and have a narrower range of validity. The Newton-Raphson (NR) method is used on the logarithm of water vapour pressure as a function of temperature, which is a very smooth function Convergence is usually achieved in 3 to 5 iterations. tDryBulb is not really needed here, just used for convenience.
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Partial pressure of water vapor in moist air in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: (o) Dew Point temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetVapPresFromTDewPoint(System.Double)
member.summary: Return vapor pressure given dew point temperature. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn. 36
member.param: Dew point temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
member.returns: Partial pressure of water vapor in moist air in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]

member.summary: Return wet-bulb temperature given dry-bulb temperature, humidity ratio, and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 33 and 35 solved for Tstar

Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Wet bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]

Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Humidity Ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]

Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]

member.summary: Return dew-point temperature given dry-bulb temperature, humidity ratio, and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Dew Point temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]

Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Humidity Ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetVapPresFromHumRatio(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return vapor pressure given humidity ratio and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 20 solved for pw
member.param: Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Partial pressure of water vapor in moist air in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetSpecificHumFromHumRatio(System.Double)
member.summary: Return the specific humidity from humidity ratio (aka mixing ratio) Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 9b
member.param: Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]
member.returns: Specific humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetHumRatioFromSpecificHum(System.Double)
member.summary: Return the humidity ratio (aka mixing ratio) from specific humidity Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 9b (solved for humidity ratio)
member.returns: Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Dry_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Dry_Air⁻¹ [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetDryAirEnthalpy(System.Double)
member.summary: Return dry-air enthalpy given dry-bulb temperature. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn. 28
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
member.returns: Dry air enthalpy in Btu lb⁻¹ [IP] or J kg⁻¹ [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetDryAirDensity(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return dry-air density given dry-bulb temperature and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 Notes: eqn 14 for the perfect gas relationship for dry air. Eqn 1 for the universal gas constant. The factor 144 in IP is for the conversion of Psi = lb in⁻² to lb ft⁻².
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Dry air density in lb ft⁻³ [IP] or kg m⁻³ [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetDryAirVolume(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return dry-air volume given dry-bulb temperature and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1. Notes: eqn 14 for the perfect gas relationship for dry air. Eqn 1 for the universal gas constant. The factor 144 in IP is for the conversion of Psi = lb in⁻² to lb ft⁻².
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Dry air volume ft³ lb⁻¹ [IP] or in m³ kg⁻¹ [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetTDryBulbFromEnthalpyAndHumRatio(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return dry bulb temperature from enthalpy and humidity ratio. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 30. Notes: based on the `GetMoistAirEnthalpy` function, rearranged for temperature.
member.param: Moist air enthalpy in Btu lb⁻¹ [IP] or J kg⁻¹
Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]
member.returns: Dry-bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetHumRatioFromEnthalpyAndTDryBulb(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return humidity ratio from enthalpy and dry-bulb temperature. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 30. Notes: based on the `GetMoistAirEnthalpy` function, rearranged for humidity ratio.
member.param: Moist air enthalpy in Btu lb⁻¹ [IP] or J kg⁻¹
Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
member.returns: Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetSatVapPres(System.Double)
member.summary: Return saturation vapor pressure given dry-bulb temperature. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn. 5 & 6 Important note: the ASHRAE formulae are defined above and below the freezing point but have a discontinuity at the freezing point. This is a small inaccuracy on ASHRAE's part: the formulae should be defined above and below the triple point of water (not the feezing point) in which case the discontinuity vanishes. It is essential to use the triple point of water otherwise function GetTDewPointFromVapPres, which inverts the present function, does not converge properly around the freezing point.
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
member.returns: Vapor pressure of saturated air in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetSatHumRatio(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return humidity ratio of saturated air given dry-bulb temperature and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 36, solved for W
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Humidity ratio of saturated air in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetSatAirEnthalpy(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return saturated air enthalpy given dry-bulb temperature and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Saturated air enthalpy in Btu lb⁻¹ [IP] or J kg⁻¹ [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetVaporPressureDeficit(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return Vapor pressure deficit given dry-bulb temperature, humidity ratio, and pressure. Reference: see Oke (1987) eqn. 2.13a
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Vapor pressure deficit in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetDegreeOfSaturation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return the degree of saturation (i.e humidity ratio of the air / humidity ratio of the air at saturation at the same temperature and pressure) given dry-bulb temperature, humidity ratio, and atmospheric pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2009) ch. 1 eqn. 12 Notes: the definition is absent from the 2017 Handbook
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Degree of saturation (unitless)

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetMoistAirEnthalpy(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return moist air enthalpy given dry-bulb temperature and humidity ratio. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn. 30
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]
member.returns: Moist Air Enthalpy in Btu lb⁻¹ [IP] or J kg⁻¹ [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetMoistAirVolume(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return moist air specific volume given dry-bulb temperature, humidity ratio, and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn. 26 Notes: in IP units, R_DA_IP / 144 equals 0.370486 which is the coefficient appearing in eqn 26. The factor 144 is for the conversion of Psi = lb in⁻² to lb ft⁻².
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Specific Volume ft³ lb⁻¹ [IP] or in m³ kg⁻¹ [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetTDryBulbFromMoistAirVolumeAndHumRatio(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return dry-bulb temperature given moist air specific volume, humidity ratio, and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 26 Notes: In IP units, R_DA_IP / 144 equals 0.370486 which is the coefficient appearing in eqn 26 The factor 144 is for the conversion of Psi = lb in⁻² to lb ft⁻². Based on the `GetMoistAirVolume` function, rearranged for dry-bulb temperature.
member.param: Specific volume of moist air in ft³ lb⁻¹ of dry air [IP] or in m³ kg⁻¹ of dry air [SI]
Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Dry-bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetMoistAirDensity(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return moist air density given humidity ratio, dry bulb temperature, and pressure. Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn. 11
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Humidity ratio in lb_H₂O lb_Air⁻¹ [IP] or kg_H₂O kg_Air⁻¹ [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Moist air density in lb ft⁻³ [IP] or kg m⁻³ [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetStandardAtmPressure(System.Double)
member.summary: Return standard atmosphere barometric pressure, given the elevation (altitude). Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 3
member.param: altitude in ft [IP] or m [SI]
member.returns: Standard atmosphere barometric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetStandardAtmTemperature(System.Double)
member.summary: Return standard atmosphere temperature, given the elevation (altitude). Reference: ASHRAE Handbook - Fundamentals (2017) ch. 1 eqn 4
member.param: altitude in ft [IP] or m [SI]
member.returns: Standard atmosphere dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetSeaLevelPressure(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return sea level pressure given dry-bulb temperature, altitude above sea level and pressure. Reference: Hess SL, Introduction to theoretical meteorology, Holt Rinehart and Winston, NY 1959, ch. 6.5; Stull RB, Meteorology for scientists and engineers, 2nd edition, Brooks/Cole 2000, ch. 1. Notes: the standard procedure for the US is to use for tDryBulb the average of the current station temperature and the station temperature from 12 hours ago.
member.param: Observed station pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
Altitude above sea level in ft [IP] or m [SI]
Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
member.returns: Sea level barometric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.GetStationPressure(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Return station pressure from sea level pressure Reference: see 'GetSeaLevelPressure' Notes: this function is just the inverse of 'GetSeaLevelPressure'.
member.param: Sea level barometric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
Altitude above sea level in ft [IP] or m [SI]
Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
member.returns: Station pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.CalcPsychrometricsFromTWetBulb(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Utility function to calculate humidity ratio, dew-point temperature, relative humidity, vapour pressure, moist air enthalpy, moist air volume, and degree of saturation of air given dry-bulb temperature, wet-bulb temperature, and pressure.
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Wet bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Calculated values.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.CalcPsychrometricsFromTDewPoint(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Utility function to calculate humidity ratio, wet-bulb temperature, relative humidity, vapour pressure, moist air enthalpy, moist air volume, and degree of saturation of air given dry-bulb temperature, dew-point temperature, and pressure.
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Dew point temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Calculated values.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.Psychrometrics.CalcPsychrometricsFromRelHum(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Utility function to calculate humidity ratio, wet-bulb temperature, dew-point temperature, vapour pressure, moist air enthalpy, moist air volume, and degree of saturation of air given dry-bulb temperature, relative humidity and pressure.
member.param: Dry bulb temperature in °F [IP] or °C [SI]
Relative humidity [0-1]
Atmospheric pressure in Psi [IP] or Pa [SI]
member.returns: Calculated values.

member.name: T:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper
member.summary: Helpers for weather.

member.name: F:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.MeanSeaLevel
member.summary: The mean sea-level pressure (MSLP) is the average atmospheric pressure at mean sea level.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateHeatIndex(UnitsNet.Temperature,UnitsNet.RelativeHumidity)
member.summary: The heat index (or apparent temperature) is used to measure the amount of discomfort during the summer months when heat and humidity often combine to make it feel hotter than it actually is. The heat index is usually used for afternoon high temperatures.
member.param: The dry air temperature.
The relative humidity (RH).
member.returns: The heat index, also known as the apparent temperature.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateSaturatedVaporPressureOverWater(UnitsNet.Temperature)
member.summary: Calculates the saturated vapor pressure for a given air temperature over water. The formula used is valid for temperatures between -100°C and +100°C.
member.param: The dry air temperature.
member.returns: The saturated vapor pressure.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateSaturatedVaporPressureOverIce(UnitsNet.Temperature)
member.summary: Calculates the saturated vapor pressure for a given air temperature over ice. The formula used is valid for temperatures between -100°C and +0°C.
member.param: The dry air temperature.
member.returns: The saturated vapor pressure.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateActualVaporPressure(UnitsNet.Temperature,UnitsNet.RelativeHumidity)
member.summary: Calculates the actual vapor pressure.
member.param: The dry air temperature.
The relative humidity (RH).
member.returns: The actual vapor pressure.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateDewPoint(UnitsNet.Temperature,UnitsNet.RelativeHumidity)
member.summary: Calculates the dew point.
member.param: The dry air temperature.
The relative humidity (RH).
member.returns: The dew point.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateAbsoluteHumidity(UnitsNet.Temperature,UnitsNet.RelativeHumidity)
member.summary: Calculates the absolute humidity in g/m³
member.param: The dry air temperature
The relative humidity (RH)
member.returns: The absolute humidity in g/m³

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.GetRelativeHumidityFromActualAirTemperature(UnitsNet.Temperature,UnitsNet.RelativeHumidity,UnitsNet.Temperature)
member.summary: Calculates a corrected relative humidity. This is useful if you have a temperature/humidity sensor that is placed in a location where the temperature is different from the real ambient temperature (like it sits inside a hot case) and another temperature-only sensor that gives more reasonable ambient temperature readings. Do note that the relative humidity is dependent on the temperature, because it depends on how much water a volume of air can contain, which increases with temperature.
member.param: Temperature measured by the humidity sensor
Humidity measured
Temperature measured by better placed sensor
member.returns: A corrected humidity. The value will be lower than the input value if the better placed sensor is cooler than the "bad" sensor.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateAltitude(UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Temperature)
member.summary: Calculates the altitude in meters from the given pressure, sea-level pressure and air temperature.
member.param: The pressure at the point for which altitude is being calculated.
The sea-level pressure.
The dry air temperature at the point for which altitude is being calculated.
member.returns: The altitude.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateAltitude(UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Temperature)
member.summary: Calculates the altitude in meters from the given pressure and air temperature. Assumes mean sea-level pressure.
member.param: The pressure at the point for which altitude is being calculated.
The dry air temperature at the point for which altitude is being calculated.
member.returns: The altitude.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateAltitude(UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Pressure)
member.summary: Calculates the altitude in meters from the given pressure and sea-level pressure. Assumes temperature of 15C.
member.param: The pressure at the point for which altitude is being calculated.
The sea-level pressure.
member.returns: The altitude.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateAltitude(UnitsNet.Pressure)
member.summary: Calculates the altitude in meters from the given pressure. Assumes mean sea-level pressure and temperature of 15C.
member.param: The pressure at the point for which altitude is being calculated.
member.returns: The altitude.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateSeaLevelPressure(UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Length,UnitsNet.Temperature)
member.summary: Calculates the approximate sea-level pressure from given absolute pressure, altitude and air temperature.
member.param: The air pressure at the point of measurement.
The altitude at the point of the measurement.
The air temperature.
member.returns: The estimated absolute sea-level pressure.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculatePressure(UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Length,UnitsNet.Temperature)
member.summary: Calculates the approximate absolute pressure from given sea-level pressure, altitude and air temperature.
member.param: The sea-level pressure.
The altitude in meters at the point for which pressure is being calculated.
The air temperature at the point for which pressure is being calculated.
member.returns: The estimated absolute pressure at the given altitude.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateTemperature(UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Length)
member.summary: Calculates the temperature gradient for the given pressure difference.
member.param: The air pressure at the point for which temperature is being calculated.
The sea-level pressure.
The altitude in meters at the point for which temperature is being calculated.
member.returns: The standard temperature at the given altitude, when the given pressure difference is known.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateBarometricPressure(UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Temperature,UnitsNet.Length)
member.summary:
Calculates the barometric pressure from a raw reading, using the reduction formula from the german met service. This is a more complex variant of . It gives the value that a weather station gives for a particular area and is also used in meteorological charts.
You are at 650m over sea and measure a pressure of 948.7 hPa and a temperature of 24.0°C. The met service will show that you are within a high-pressure area of around 1020 hPa.
member.param: Measured pressure at the observation point.
Measured temperature at the observation point.

Height over sea level of the observation point (to be really precise, geopotential heights have to be used above ~750m). Do not use the height obtained by calling or any of its overloads, since what would use redundant data.
member.returns: The barometric pressure at the point of observation.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateBarometricPressure(UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Temperature,UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Length)
member.summary:
Calculates the barometric pressure from a raw reading, using the reduction formula from the german met service. This is a more complex variant of . It gives the value that a weather station gives for a particular area and is also used in meteorological charts.
You are at 650m over sea and measure a pressure of 948.7 hPa and a temperature of 24.0°C. The met service will show that you are within a high-pressure area of around 1020 hPa.
member.param: Measured pressure at the observation point.
Measured temperature at the observation point.
Vapor pressure, meteorologic definition.
Height over sea level of the observation point (to be really precise, geopotential heights have to be used above ~750m).
member.returns: The barometric pressure at the point of observation.

member.name: M:EazyLab.PsychroLib.WeatherHelper.CalculateBarometricPressure(UnitsNet.Pressure,UnitsNet.Temperature,UnitsNet.Length,UnitsNet.RelativeHumidity)
member.summary: Calculates the barometric pressure from a raw reading, using the reduction formula from the german met service. This is a more complex variant of . It gives the value that a weather station gives for a particular area and is also used in meteorological charts. Use this method if you also have the relative humidity.
member.param: Measured pressure at the observation point.
Measured temperature at the observation point.
Height over sea level of the observation point (to be really precise, geopotential heights have to be used above ~750m).
Relative humidity at point of measurement.
member.returns: The barometric pressure at the point of observation.
